<!-- If you update this article, please remember to update other Ubuntu derivatives, which include, but are not limited to: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, Edubuntu, Xubuntu, Gobuntu. --> {{Infobox OS | name = Ubuntu Netbook Edition | logo = [[Image:Ubuntu logo.svg|Ubuntu logo|200px]] | screenshot = [[Image:Ubuntu 10.10 Maverick Meerkat Netbook Live USB.png|300px]] | caption = Ubuntu 10.10 (Maverick Meerkat) Netbook Edition | developer = [[Canonical Ltd.]] / [[Ubuntu Foundation]] | family = [[Unix-like]] | source_model = [[Free and open source software]] | latest_release_version = 10.10 | latest_release_date = {{release date|2010|10|10}}<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.ubuntu.com/netbook | title = Download Ubuntu Netbook Edition | publisher = Ubuntu | accessdate = 2010-05-02 }}</ref> | latest_test_version = | latest_test_date = | language = Multilingual | kernel_type = [[Monolithic kernel|Monolithic]] ([[Linux kernel|Linux]]) | ui = [[GNOME]] + Unity | license = Mainly the [[GNU General Public License|GNU GPL]] / Various others | working_state = Merged into desktop edition from Ubuntu 11.04<ref name="Ubuntu1104alpha1" /> | supported_platforms = [[IA-32]] | updatemodel = [[Advanced Packaging Tool|APT]] (front-ends available) | package_manager = [[dpkg]] (front-ends like [[Synaptic (software)|Synaptic]] available) }}
'''Ubuntu Netbook Edition (UNE)''', known as '''Ubuntu Netbook Remix''' prior to the release of [[Ubuntu 10.04]],<ref>https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Specs/DesktopLucidUNE</ref><ref>https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/desktop-lucid-une</ref><ref>http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2009/11/ubuntu-netbook-remix-to-be-renamed.html</ref> was a version of the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu Linux distribution]] that had been optimized to enable it to work better on [[netbook]]s and other devices with small screens or with the [[Intel Atom]] [[Central processing unit|CPU]].
UNE was available starting with Ubuntu release 8.04 ("[[Hardy Heron]]"). UNE was also an optional preinstalled [[operating system]] (OS) on some netbooks such as [[Dell Inspiron Mini Series|Dell Inspiron Mini]] 10v and the [[Toshiba]] NB100, and also ran on popular models such as the [[Acer Aspire One]] and the [[Asus Eee PC]].
[[Canonical Ltd.|Canonical]], the developers of Ubuntu, are collaborating with [[Moblin|Moblin project]] to ensure optimization for lower hardware requirements and longer battery life.<ref name="Moblin"> {{Cite web|url = http://www.ubuntu.com/news/canoical-commits-ubuntu-moblin|title = Canonical announces support for Moblin v2|accessdate = 10 December 2010|last = [[Canonical Ltd]]|authorlink = |year = 2009|month = June}}</ref>
Beginning with version 10.10, Ubuntu Netbook Edition used the [[Unity (desktop environment)|Unity]] desktop as its desktop interface. The classic netbook interface was available in Ubuntu's software repositories as an option.<ref name="LaunchpadUnityHist"> {{Cite web|url = https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/unity/+publishinghistory|title = Publishing history of âunityâ package in Ubuntu|accessdate = 30 August 2011|last = [[Canonical Ltd]]|authorlink = |year = 2011|month = August}}</ref><ref name="PCWorld03May11"> {{Cite news|url = http://www.pcworld.com/businesscenter/article/226940/natty_narwhal_the_first_linux_for_newbies.html |title = Natty Narwhal: the First Linux for Newbies?|accessdate = 1 September 2011|last = Noyes|first = Katherine|authorlink = |year = 2011|month = May| work = [[PC World]]}}</ref>
Because Ubuntu's desktop edition has moved to the same Unity interface as the netbook edition, starting with [[Ubuntu 11.04]], the netbook edition has been merged into the desktop edition.<ref name="Ubuntu1104alpha1"> {{Cite web|url = http://www.ubuntu.com/testing/natty/alpha1|title = Natty Narwhal Alpha 1|accessdate = 03 December 2010|last = Canonical Ltd|authorlink = |year = 2010|month = December}}</ref>
==Installation== UNE could be installed in several ways: * by first installing the regular Ubuntu package, then adding the UNE repository<ref>https://launchpad.net/~netbook-remix-team/+archive/ppa</ref> and installing the relevant packages. Starting with Ubuntu 10.04, the packages are available on main repositories. * by downloading UNE directly from the Ubuntu server, as either a .iso or .img file and writing the file to a USB stick (using Ubuntu Live USB Creator or UNetbootin) or CD. * an option to install via the [[Wubi (Ubuntu installer)|Wubi installer]] is available for the 10.04 "[[Lucid Lynx]]" release.<ref>https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/mobile-unr-karmic-wubi</ref>
==Unity== {{Main|Unity (desktop environment)}} Starting with UNE 10.10, the interface was switched to Unity. Due to the desktop version of Ubuntu also being changed to the Unity interface, the netbook edition was rolled into the general Ubuntu distribution starting with [[Ubuntu 11.04 Natty Narwhal]] and the netbook edition was discontinued as a separate distribution.<ref name="Ubuntu1104alpha1" />
==Variants== [[Dell]] Ubuntu Netbook Edition is built specifically for the hardware profile of the [[Dell Inspiron Mini Series|Inspiron Mini]] 9, and is also available for the [[Dell Inspiron Mini Series|Inspiron Mini]] 12. It includes a custom built interface and launcher as well as non-free codecs such as [[MPEG-4]] and [[MP3]]. It began shipping on September 22, 2008.<ref>http://www.dell.com/conten/products/productdetails.aspx/laptop-inspiron-9?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs</ref>
[[EasyPeasy]] is considered to be among the first UNE-based distributions, with a focus on the usage of [[proprietary software]] like [[Skype]] by default and also integrating a set of different standard applications and drivers.{{Citation needed|date=August 2010}}
==Specifications== ;Minimum System Requirements<ref>[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/SystemRequirements#Ubuntu Netbook Edition Ubuntu System Requirements]. Canonical. Retrieved on 2009-11-08.</ref>
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Processor ! RAM ! Storage |- | 1.6 GHz Intel Atom processor | 512 MB RAM | 4 GB Flash disk ([[Solid-state drive|SSD]]) or [[Hard disk drive|hard disk]] |}
Ubuntu Netbook Edition installed and ran correctly on the original Celeron M 900 MHz Asus Eee PC, but performance and graphical displays were hindered in comparison to [[Intel Atom|Atom]]-based netbooks.{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}}
==Applications== ===Standard=== * Web browser - [[Mozilla Firefox|Firefox]] * E-mail client - [[Evolution (software)|Evolution]] * Instant messenger - [[Empathy (software)|Empathy]] * Media player - [[Rhythmbox]] * Photo viewer - [[Shotwell (software)|Shotwell]] * Office suite - [[OpenOffice.org]]
===Optional=== * [[Adobe Acrobat|Adobe Reader]] * [[Java Virtual Machine]] * [[Skype]] * [[Banshee (media player)|Banshee]]
===Codecs for OEMs=== * [[MPEG-4]] ([[H.263]]) * [[MP3]] * [[Advanced Audio Coding|AAC]] * [[Windows Media]]
===Other=== * [[Mozilla Thunderbird|Thunderbird]] * [[Songbird (software)|Songbird]] <ref>[http://skyzim.com/songbird-1-7-3-installer/ no longer supported by Songbird, and never featuring in the repository, the last release is available]</ref> * [[BBC iPlayer]] (needs to install [[Adobe Air]] to run) * [[GIMP]]
==Devices== Ubuntu Netbook Edition was officially shipped with the following netbooks: * Sylvania G Netbook Meso<ref>[http://www.linuxinsider.com/rsstory/65704.html?wlc=1236620373/ Welcome to LinuxInsider]. Linuxinsider.com. Retrieved on 2009-11-08.</ref> * Toshiba NB100<ref>http://eu.computers.toshiba-europe.com/innovation/generic/NB100/banner_id/Q3_QosmioBubble_LRGBANNER_TEG08/</ref> * System76 Starling Netbook<ref>[http://system76.com/product_info.php?cPath=28&products_id=92 Starling NetBook - Ubuntu Linux Laptop - 10 inch - system76, Inc]. System76.com. Retrieved on 2009-11-08.</ref> * Dell Mini10v, Mini10, Latitude 2100 & Latitude 2110 * Advent 4211C * Samsung N110 (This product is no longer available) * ZaReason Terra HD netbook and other ZaReason laptop models<ref>[https://zareason.com/shop/Laptops/ Laptops :: ZaReason, Inc.]</ref>
==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} * [[Comparison of netbook-oriented Linux distributions]] * [[Joli OS]] * [[EasyPeasy]] * [[Eeebuntu]] * [[Leeenux Linux]]
